trans-unit.source: Represents a control that allows the user to select a date.
The DatePicker control allows the user to select a date by either typing it into a text field or by using a drop-down <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar> control.

Many of a DatePicker control's properties are for managing its built-in <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar>, and function identically to the equivalent property in <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar>.

In particular, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.IsTodayHighlighted%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.FirstDayOfWeek%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.BlackoutDates%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.DisplayDateStart%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.DisplayDateEnd%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.DisplayDate%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.SelectedDate%2A?displayProperty=fullName> properties function identically to their <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar> counterparts.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar>.
Users can type a date directly into a text field, which sets the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.Text%2A> property.
If the DatePicker cannot convert the entered string to a valid date, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.DateValidationError> event will be raised.

By default, this causes an exception, but an event handler for <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.DateValidationError> can set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePickerDateValidationErrorEventArgs.ThrowException%2A> property to `false` and prevent an exception from being raised.
> [!NOTE] > The DatePicker supports only the Gregorian calendar.
Customizing the DatePicker Control To apply the same property settings to multiple DatePicker controls, use the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Style%2A> property.
You can modify the default <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> to give the control a unique appearance.

For more information about creating a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate>, see [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To see the parts and states that are specific to the DatePicker, see [DatePicker Syles and Templates](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Dependency properties for this control might be set by the controlâ€™s default style.
If a property is set by a default style, the property might change from its default value when the control appears in the application.
The default style is determined by which desktop theme is used when the application is running.
For more information, see [Default WPF Themes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=158252).
> [!NOTE] > Setting a visual property will only have an effect if that property is both present in Button control's default template and is set by using a .

You can find a list of visual properties in the "Changing the Visual Structure of a Control" section in [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](../Topic/Customizing%20the%20Appearance%20of%20an%20Existing%20Control%20by%20Creating%20a%20ControlTemplate.md).
## XAML Object Element Usage ``` ```
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker"></xref> class.
Gets or sets a collection of dates that are marked as not selectable.
Dates in this collection will appear as disabled on the drop-down calendar.
If the user types a date that is not selectable, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.DateValidationError> event occurs.
To make all past dates not selectable, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.CalendarBlackoutDatesCollection.AddDatesInPast%2A> method provided by the collection returned by this property.

Adding a date to this collection when it is already selected or adding a date outside the range specified by <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.DisplayDateStart%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.DisplayDateEnd%2A> will cause an <xref:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException>.
## XAML Property Element Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Values *oneOrMoreCalendarDateRanges* One or more object elements of type .
A collection of dates that cannot be selected.
The default value is an empty collection.
Occurs when the drop-down <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Calendar"></xref> is closed.
## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ```
To be added.
Occurs when the drop-down <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Calendar"></xref> is opened.
## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ```
To be added.
Gets or sets the style that is used when rendering the calendar.
Use the CalendarStyle property to specify the appearance of the drop-down calendar.

## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to **true**|None| ## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Values *resourceExtension* One of the following: `StaticResource` or `DynamicResource`.
For more information, see [XAML Resources](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
*styleResourceKey* The key that identifies the template being requested.
The key refers to an existing resource in a <xref:System.Windows.ResourceDictionary>.
The style that is used when rendering the calendar.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.CalendarStyle*> dependency property.
To be added.
Occurs when <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.Text*> is set to a value that cannot be interpreted as a date or when the date cannot be selected.

After the DateValidationError event occurs, if you set the property to `true`, one of the following exceptions is raised: |Exception type|Condition| |--------------------|---------------| ||The text entered cannot be parsed to a valid date, and the exception is not suppressed.| ||The text entered parses to a date that is not selectable.| ## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ```
To be added.
Gets or sets the date to display.
This property affects the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar> of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker>.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.DisplayDate%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to **true**|| This property allows the developer to specify a date to display if is `null`.
## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Values *dateTimeString* A date that is in one of the formats that are listed in the [DateTime XAML Syntax](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) topic.
The date to display.
The default is <xref:System.DateTime.Today%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
The specified date is not in the range defined by <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.DisplayDateStart*>. and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.DisplayDateEnd*>.
Gets or sets the last date to be displayed.
This property affects the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar> of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker>.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.DisplayDateEnd%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.

## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to **true**|| ## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Values *dateTimeString* A date that is in one of the formats that are listed in the [DateTime XAML Syntax](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) topic.
The last date to display.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.DisplayDateEnd*> dependency property.
To be added.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.DisplayDate*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the first date to be displayed.
This property affects the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar> of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker>.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.DisplayDateStart%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.

## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to **true**|| ## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Values *dateTimeString* A date that is in one of the formats that are listed in the [DateTime XAML Syntax](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) topic.
The first date to display.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.DisplayDateStart*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the day that is considered the beginning of the week.
A <xref:System.DayOfWeek> that represents the beginning of the week.
The default is the <xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.FirstDayOfWeek*> that is determined by the current culture.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.FirstDayOfWeek*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker"></xref> has focus.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker"></xref> has focus; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the drop-down <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Calendar"></xref> is open or closed.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to **true**|| Setting this property will cause the drop-down to open or close.
## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ```

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Calendar"></xref> is open; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.IsDropDownOpen*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the current date will be highlighted.
This property affects the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar> of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker>.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.IsTodayHighlighted%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to **true**|None| ## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ```
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the current date is highlighted; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.IsTodayHighlighted*> dependency property.
To be added.
Builds the visual tree for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker"></xref> control when a new template is applied.
This method is invoked whenever application code or an internal process, such as rebuilding layout pass, calls the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ApplyTemplate%2A> method.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.CalendarClosed"></xref> routed event.
The data for the event.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.CalendarOpened"></xref> routed event.
The data for the event.
Returns a <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.DatePickerAutomationPeer"></xref> for use by the automation infrastructure.

This method creates a new <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.DatePickerAutomationPeer> instance if one has not been created for the control instance; otherwise, it returns the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.DatePickerAutomationPeer> previously created.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.DatePickerAutomationPeer"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker"></xref> object.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.DateValidationError"></xref> event.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DatePickerDateValidationErrorEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.SelectedDateChanged"></xref> routed event.
The control raises the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.SelectedDateChanged> event by calling <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.RaiseEvent%2A>.
For more information, see [Routed Events Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The data for the event.
Gets or sets the currently selected date.
This property affects the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar> of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker>.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.SelectedDate%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.

## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to **true**|| ## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Values *dateTimeString* A date that is in one of the formats that are listed in the [DateTime XAML Syntax](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) topic.
The date currently selected.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.

The specified date is not in the range defined by <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.DisplayDateStart*> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.DisplayDateEnd*>, or the specified date is in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.BlackoutDates*> collection.
Occurs when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.SelectedDate*> property is changed.
## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ```
To be added.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.SelectedDateChanged"></xref> routed event.
To be added.
Gets or sets the format that is used to display the selected date.
The format that is used to display the selected date.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DatePickerFormat"></xref>.
The specified format is not valid.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.SelectedDateFormat*> dependency property.
To be added.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.SelectedDate*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets the text that is displayed by the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker"></xref>, or sets the selected date.
A user can set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.SelectedDate%2A> of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker> by typing a date into its text box.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker> attempts to parse any string entered into this property as a date.

While the Text property can be set to any string that can be parsed by the <xref:System.DateTime.Parse%2A> method date, the format of the string that is returned depends on the value of the <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
This means that the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker> might display a string that is different than what the user typed.
If Text is set to a date that is selectable and valid, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.DateValidationError> event occurs.

If you handle the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.DateValidationError> event and set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePickerDateValidationErrorEventArgs.ThrowException%2A> property to `true`, a <xref:System.FormatException> or <xref:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException> is raised.

## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to **true**|None| ## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Values *dateTimeString* A date that is in one of the formats that are listed in the [DateTime XAML Syntax](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) topic.
The text displayed by the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker"></xref>.
The default is an empty string.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.Text*> dependency property.
To be added.
Provides a text representation of the selected date.
A text representation of the selected date, or an empty string if <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DatePicker.SelectedDate*> is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
